quotes: proposal was partly blamed for the DPJ losing its majority in the July 2010 House of Councillors election.
In August 2010, Kan apologized to South Korea.
In September, Ichirō Ozawa challenged Kan for the leadership of the DPJ.
On September 7, 2010, a Chinese fishing boat captain was arrested by the Japan Coast Guard.
The captain was released on September 24.
In mid-September, Kan's government took action to weaken the Japanese yen.
In October, the Kan cabinet approved a large spending plan to further weaken the yen and fight deflation.
In November, Kan strongly supported South Korea and criticized North Korea after the bombardment of Yeonpyeong.
On March 11, 2011, a huge earthquake and tsunami hit northeastern Japan.
In May, he ordered the Hamaoka Nuclear Power Plant to close due to safety concerns.
